name: A Day of Freedom, A Day of Reunion
description: Shan State has finally gotten enough of the Chinese dogs. The saophas are angered, and so are the people. We are called to arms. Today is a day of independence and of reunion with our Tai brothers. Men, women and children of Shan, rise up!

name: Uniting the Broken States
description: Shan State is comprised of many territories ruled by their own saophas. Some, as they are far away from the conflict, do not care much about if we win or lose. However, we must use this war as a way to convince the saophas to all band together, lest we fall into the hands of the Chinese again.

name: The Noble Sacrifices of the Tai
description: Wars are won by sacrificing one's soul for their country. Our Tai people must do the same, for even though war is not the true way, it is out of necessity that we must stain the mountains with our blood to gain freedom.

name: Resist; Defying the Invader
description: 'When the Chinese come for your families, resist, fellow countrymen! Pick up the gun and hold together! Even if you are not a soldier, the protection of your family and your motherland is of utmost importance!'

name: A Betrayal of Peace
description: With a heavy heart, Sao Shwe Thaik must agree to the final destruction of the Chinese enemy. Their defeat is our victory, and we must win at all costs to protect our sovereignty. It shall be done - they will be wiped out by our men, and justice will be done.

name: The Fight is Over
description: The deal has been signed, and Shan is no longer at war with Yunnan. We have gained full independence from the Chinese and the Burmese, and it is time to plant our stake in the world. Rejoice, for today is a day of celebration!

name: The Federalist Dream
description: The Status Quo for Shan has worked quite well over the past centuries. United we are in a decentralized federation, each state ruled by its own Saopha, and it shall be so forevermore.

name: Centralize the States
description: The system of federalism in Shan is anachronistic and requires change. The saophas lay at the command of Sao Shwe Thaik, and the Confederation must become centralized if we are to advance in the world.

name: Memories of the Independence War
description: The struggle for independence was long and bloody. But we have overcome it, and now we can apply its lesson formally to the development of the armed forces.

name: A Professional National Army
description: The decentralised structure of our forces up to this point cannot be maintained. Let us develop not only a western style professional force where every man is drilled extensively and atuned to a rigid system of command.

name: Local Defence
description: The armed forces should recognize the unique structure of our nation. Individual states should have authority over their own sections of the army and held responsible for recruitment.

name: To Preserve Peace
description: To preserve peace, we must be ready to make war. The entire citizenry must should be required to provide a small percentage of its income or harvest to the armed forces so that they may never falter.

name: The National Arsenal
description: The nations of the west have central military arsenals which engage in both production and research. We must have one of our own.

name: To the Factories
description: We should expand the military provisions program to also extend to enterprises.

name: Superior Weaponry
description: What we lack in modern machines of war, we make up for with fighting spirit. Therefore, our men must be able to fight to the best of there ability. To accomplish that, we should study foreign arms development and copy effective advanced foreign designs.

name: Sizable Armies
description: With an army which conforms to the uniqueness of different areas of the country, we can more easily recruit. Let us begin a recruitment drive in remote villages where tradition is strong.

name: The Special Forces Project
description: We will never have the numbers to stand toe to toe with the greatest powers of the world. However, highly skilled specialized units can be our great equalizer.

name: The Iron Railway
description: The nation's iron mines are connected only by dirt roads trafficked by mules. Though the terrain is extremely harsh, using modern methods, we can at last fully connect them with the cities.

name: SHA_Hto_Luumyaoe_Aarr_Karkwalraan
description: Our army has become greater and greater. Let us hold a massive parade in the capital to celebrate and display our prowess.

name: Constitutional States
description: The states should be made to draw up formal constitutions which assure equality to all regardless of clan.

name: A New Democracy
description: Democracies require robust institutions and engaged population. Let us work to inform the masses of their rights and duties.

name: Promote Buddhist Values
description: To ensure that our moral center remains intact, the state should promote theological literature. Indeed, civil servants should be required to possess basic literacy in Buddhist theology and philosophy.

name: The People First
description: While the clans may have had much influence over the basic structure of the state, all are individually equal. We should amend the new constitution to explicitly state the relationship between the stated and the individual.

name: Liberty Ends Where Violence Begins
description: Violence is often used to enforce various local traditions. This is a tragedy. We must strictly repudiate such behavior and remind the people that while tradition is important, such acts of violence cannot be permitted.

name: Reduce the Saophas' Authority
description: It is time to take the question up to the saophas. They must bend the knee and capitulate for the greater good. We must start by reducing their authority over their states, and allowing Taunggyi more control over the various regions of Shan.

name: Proclaim the New Government
description: At Taunggyi we will proclaim a new government. We are one country, with one capital and one government, the saophas retaining some of their power in the new reformed political system.

name: The Guiding Hand of Sao Shwe Thaik
description: The Tai people are loyal subjects of the government in Taunggyi, of their regions, and of Sao Shwe Thaik. Sao Shwe Thaik will guide Shan to centralization and democracy, and the people will follow.

name: Putting the Nation First
description: Too many put their clan above all else. Such loyalties are poisonous to national unity and allow foreign elements to play our people against each other. A broad propaganda campaign should be initiated to discourage such ties.

name: Redraw the States
description: Traditional clan boundaries were the basis for the shape of the states which comprise our federation. With power consolidated, we should redraw the states to include in them sizable numbers of as many clans as possible.
